threats.title: Developer commits secret to Git
threats.description: A developer commits secret to version control either accidentally or on purpose. An angry employee with read access to the repository finds the secret and proceeds to use them to steal end-user data
threats.mitigation:
Adhere to the principal of " Need to Know" and ensure that production secrets are not shared with individuals who don't have a need to know.
Adhere to the principal of "Least Privilege" and ensure secrets only have the permission to administrators.

threats.title: Unauthorised access to Git Repository
threats.description: Unauthorised access to git could expose source code or sensitive data leading to intellectual property theft
threats.mitigation:
Enforce multi-factor authentication for repository access.
regular audits on access permissions and limiting access on the principle of least privilege.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: Tampering with CI pipeline execution
threats.description: an attacked can modify pipeline configuration and add malicious code to pipeline
threats.mitigation:
implementation of multi-factor authentication and enforcement of reviews on merge and pipeline configuration.
Implement digital signature for critical configuration files.

threats.title: Insecure Docker Image Container Repository
threats.description: A Docker image with known vulnerabilities could be pushed to the repository resulting in issues in production build
threats.mitigation:
Usage of image scanning tolls to detect vulnerabilities before pushing.
Implementation of security gates to block deployment of images with critical vulnerabilities

threats.title: Unauthorised access to Pipeline Artifacts
threats.description: Unauthorised users could access artifacts stored in CI pipeline, exposing the secrets and sensitive information.
threats.mitigation:
apply Role based access control (RBAC) to access artifact access.
Also, encrypting sensitive artifacts can also be applied
